body:
Part of https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/29329

http://doc.rust-lang.org/std/thread/

Here's what needs to be done to close out this issue: 

- [ ] [the module docs](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/thread/) are written a while ago, and contain some questionableish advice. It's not actually bad, it's just not the way I'd orient all of this. A particularly enthusiastic contributor could toss this out and re-write it from scratch. If the rest of this work gets done, we can close the ticket without doing this, but it would be nice.
- [x] [`Builder`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/thread/struct.Builder.html)'s docs are... okay. Just very uninspired.
- [x] [`JoinHandle`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/thread/struct.JoinHandle.html) doesn't go into enough detail, and should show off, for example, the detach behavior.
- [x] [`LocalKey`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/thread/struct.LocalKey.html) could use some links and general cleanup.
- [x] [`Thread`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/thread/struct.Thread.html) has very little and very boring docs.
- [x] [`panicking`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/thread/fn.panicking.html) could use some more advice on when to use this.
- [x] [`park`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/thread/fn.park.html) should have its module documentation inlined here, and cleaned up.
- [x] [`park_timeout`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/thread/fn.park_timeout.html) could use links to `park`
- [x] [`spawn`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/thread/fn.spawn.html) needs a lot more docs generally. It's the main interface to this module!
- [x] [`yield_now`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/thread/fn.yield_now.html) doesn't explain any of the "why".
- [x] [`Result`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/thread/type.Result.html) should at least show off the "use std::thread; thread::Result" pattern, like all module-specific `Result` types.
